findings.title: PTAI - Potential Transfer Amount Inconsistency
findings.description: The transferred amount could potentially be less than the expected amount due to the fee or tax charged to the sender of an ERC20 token when tokens are transferred to another address.

findings.title: SRD - Stops Reward Distribution
findings.description: The reward distribution can be delayed for a huge period of time by setting the `buyBackWait` to a high value.

findings.title: SRW - Stops Reward Withdrawal
findings.description: The reward withdrawal can be stopped for any asset by setting either the `isActive` property of an asset to false or the `claimWait` property of an asset to a high value.

findings.title: DRT - Duplicate Reward Tokens
findings.description: The contract overrides the token's value with the last element of the rewardAsset array without removing the last element, resulting in duplicate tokens.

findings.title: MEM - Misleading Error Messages
findings.description: The contract is using misleading error messages which do not accurately reflect the problem, making it difficult to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: MMN - Misleading Method Naming
findings.description: Methods can have misleading names if their names do not accurately reflect the functionality they contain or the purpose they serve.

findings.title: OCTD - Transfers Contract's Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to claim all the balance of the contract.

findings.title: TUU - Time Units Usage
findings.description: The contract is using arbitrary numbers to form time-related values, which decreases the readability of the codebase and prevents the compiler from optimizing the source code.

findings.title: AAO - Accumulated Amount Overflow
findings.description: The contract could lead to an overflow when the total value of a variable exceeds the maximum value that can be stored in that variable's data type.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity and overhead, increasing gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions 0.8.0 and above have native functionality for arithmetic operations that revert to underflow and overflow.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract is using variables that initialize them only in the constructor and are not mutated by other functions, but these variables are not defined as `immutable`.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure their values cannot be changed after being set and decrease gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide's naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract, but is never used in any of the contract's functions.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract. They are often used to notify external parties or clients about events that have occurred within the contract, such as the transfer of tokens or the completion of a task.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured by user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful. Otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
